description: Has a lot of settings to tweak but good defaults so it's very easy to get started.
also getting the exit code 1 error. think it has to do with the daemon service failing

Simple but does the job it's supposed to do! Thanks for making this, it's the only good alternative out there if you don't want to run Syncthing directly as other famous wrappers like Syncthing-GTK seem to not be maintained anymore.
summary: Simple but does the job it's supposed to do!

description: Does just enough to improve the syncthing experience, without being intrusive

If you need Syncthing but don't want to layer packages on Silverblue/Kinoite, or download the official tarball on GNOME OS or Steam Deck. This is the way to go!

Could be even better if this app can also show notifications for new devices connecting, or folder marker missing as well.
I would love to try it, however it will not launch.
summary: Does not launch on Gnome 43 Fedora 37!

description: Works great, but it need more ram that syncthing gtk. I tried to put as service in steam deck and the tray icon doesn't load anymore, but the service works.
Works well, and auto runs in game mode, when you install it as system service, which it lets you do via the app
All I did was copy my non-flatpak syncthing config to the flatpak folder and it worked.
running on my deck as of today.very good app for transferring between phone, desktop and steam deck
This app didn't startup for me (on fedora silverblue) until I went to Flatseal and turned on background activity. Now it works great!
summary: turn on background activity in Flatseal

description: I use this to sync files of emulators and Steam games without Steam Cloud. Works well so far - thanks for the convenient option.
I use it once in a while to make a backup on other devices or sync somethig with the phone. It is straightforward to use and didn't require any time to setup.
Worked perfectly for me. Easy install and even has a Decky friendly port change.
Thank you for your efforts, installed as a service on GNOME, it just works.

Claims it failed to launch on startup when opening syncthing, when i check the server its apparently working just fine, icon wont show up at the bottom right hand corner like it should so i have to bookmark the server address which is annoying. Was working on my steam deck lcd version but when i upgraded to the OLED it started giving me all these issues.

Error
Syncthing failed to start! exit code (1)
summary: Syncthing failed to start! exit code(1)
